trans-unit.source: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform long-integer validation on a configuration property.
This class cannot be inherited.
You use the LongValidatorAttribute attribute to decorate a configuration property.
This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using a <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator> object and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply the LongValidatorAttribute attribute to property types only.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute"></xref> class.
You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the value assigned to the related property is a long integer.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to include or exclude the integers in the range defined by the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue*> and <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue*> property values.
The range is inclusive of the <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue%2A> property values.
When the ExcludeRange property value is `false`, the allowed values are outside the range.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value must be excluded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum value allowed for the property.
The MaxValue property value is included in the allowed range.
A long integer that indicates the allowed maximum value.
The selected value is less than <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MinValue*>.
Gets or sets the minimum value allowed for the property.
The MinValue property value is included in the allowed range.
An integer that indicates the allowed minimum value.
The selected value is greater than <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidatorAttribute.MaxValue*>.
Gets an instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.LongValidator"></xref> class.
You use the ValidatorInstance property value to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.LongValidator.Validate%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorBase"></xref> validator instance.
